page.title: 17Sewage Farm
page.content: The sewage farm at{Shottermill}serves 17000 people and every day 5000 to 6000 cubic metres of sewage pass through the works. If it rains, the figure rises to about 14000 cubic metres as the drains empty into the system. At the beginning of the sewage cycle the plastics are chopped up in order that they do not block up the works. A special filter chamber removes the sand and grit. In the primary tanks the solids are separated and then treated in the activated sludge plant which, with the aid of bacteria, takes about nine hours to break down the sludge. The liquid part is treated in filter-beds and emerges with only 20 parts per million of solids. The sludge is further treated in a digester where it is heated, thus liberating the gases and removing much
